data.title: Enhance Sandworm behaviour
data.body:
I took some time before filing the PR to split the work into (mostly) self-contained work items, each in its own commit. The commit messages should reflect what happens where.

As a side effect, worms should have no more problems with targets moving out of range during the attack, reaching solid ground or being picked up by a carryall.

P.S.: I intentionally didn't make any of the discussed changes for making worms "less aggressive", because these are behavior/logic changes, and those will be balancing changes. I will file a follow-up PR for them once this is done.

data.title: Minor targeting cleanup
data.body:
A couple of simple clean-up fixes to the current targeting:
- Removed `AttackFollow.CanAttack()` since it doesn't do anything that its `base.CanAttack()` doesn't. Also unlike `AttackFollow.CanAttack()`, the base method has a `self.IsInWorld` check, which comes after the removed target validity check.
- Exposed an Info field in the `DetectCloaked` trait in order to remove
  `a.Actor.Info.Traits.Get<DetectCloakedInfo>();`
  because `ActorsWithTrait<DetectCloaked>()` already gives us the needed trait and it is redundant to do another `Traits.Get<>()`
- `TargetableUnit.TargetableBy()` shouldn't check if the actor is cloaked. `cloak.IsVisible()` does that.

In theory this should have a marginally positive effect on late-game performance. Other than that, mostly cleanup stuff.

data.title: Formatted all files.
data.body: Figured since everything was just StyleCop'd - we might as well round things off and unify the formatting a bit. I mostly let VS just autoformat everything, but I did manually fix up a few files.

data.title: Clean up D2k YAML files.
data.body:
Example:
Combat tanks for all 3 Houses (`COMBATA`, `COMBATH`, `COMBATO`) have some traits attached to them that are also attached to `^COMBAT`, which they all inherit from. (with no changes to the traits' Info) This is not much of an issue, but I think it would be nice polishing.
I'm mainly dropping this here because I don't currently have the time to do it. If anyone feels like doing it - go ahead. If not - I hope I'll get around to it eventually.

data.title: Fixed WithCargo
data.body: Fixes the breakages spotted at https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7229#issuecomment-68625429 introduced in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7178. I took the time to make this far more robust and easy to use. Before, `WithCargo` would crash the game when relying only on the default values which is something we avoided for almost any other trait.

data.title: WithCargo regression
data.body: The offset issues with TD hover transports were introduced in #7178.

data.title: Moved more traits & activities to Mods.Common
data.body: Mostly infantry and building traits.

data.title: StyleCop clean OpenRA.Mods.RA and enforce rules with Makefile
data.body: A followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7268 to make the project as a whole StyleCop clean to auto-check pull requests for regressions.

data.title: Some general polish
data.body:
Split from #7164 as requested (https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7164#issuecomment-68462738).

What I did in this PR:
- "Disabled" messages like "xyz30 changed map difficulty to ." (that e.g. occur when selecting a mission without any difficulties after playing one with difficulties.)
- Updated the legacy map importer in order to omit `Facing: 0` and `Health: 1` while importing (as they are default values)
- Fixed a crash (my fault) when removing (OnEntered) ProximityTriggers
- Now you return from skirmish lobby to singleplayer menu instead of main menu
- Fixed #4976

data.title: StyleCop clean OpenRA.Game Part 2 and enforce rules with Makefile
data.body: This is a followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7251. The last 30 warnings are heavy, because they rename the most frequently referenced public variables. Don't worry about the diff cut off. Everything outside `OpenRA.Game` is just automatic renamings to adjust to the changes.

data.body:
See gifs below for mentioned effect and changed behavior

Before:

After:
https://www.dropbox.com/s/wjk0n15t8l3p6cr/ra-after-fix.gif?dl=0

data.title: Add StyleCop checks for Game, Editor and Mod dlls to make.ps1
data.body: Allows Windows users to check Game.exe and dlls more easily.

data.title: Fix a race condition in the map download code.
data.body: Fixes #7264.

data.title: Moved Armament, Attack, Move, Air features and dependencies to Mods.Common
data.body:
Sorry for this monster of a commit, but the code is too entangled to break it into smaller chunks (unless you can live with non-compileable commits).

Applied StyleCop fixes, extracted Exit trait into its own file, tested in-game for any noticable regressions, didn't notice anything out of the ordinary.

data.title: Fix ActorMap spatial partitioning to actually work.
data.body:
The bin partitioning in ActorMap worked by dividing the map up into a few chunks of cells, each of which would contain some actors. Unfortunately, the bins were accessed directly in world coordinates which are on a scale 1024x greater than cell coordinates. This lead to all actors being placed into the bottom right bin. When checking for actors in a box, only this bottom right bin would be iterated for actors. Thanks to the fact this bin indeed contained all the actors, some clamps on the input ranges and filtering required per bin anyway, this actually returned correct results. Effectively, it was as if there was no spatial partitioning at all.

Not surprisingly however, this is fairly inefficient. By correcting the spatial partitioning to actually partition we see a 7x speedup in ActorsInBox on the RA shellmap.

I tested this programatically by having the results of this new method compared against those from just checking all the actors each time ActorsInBox was called. There were no differences whilst the RA shellmap was running.

data.title: map.yaml cleanup
data.body:
Split from #7164 as requested (https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7164#issuecomment-68462738).

This PR...
- Removes unused waypoints
- Renames actors that still have standart names ("waypoint1") to something more reasonable
- Reorderes all named actors; now they're at the end of the "Actors" list

data.title: Fix broken pathing
data.body:
Fixes #7258 by fixing a regression introduced in #7108.

The region covered by map.Cells may not cover the whole map size, but we need the whole cache initialized so it can be used correctly when a different map is used, because that map may have the same size but a different offset which means a different region is covered.

data.title: D2K - Fixed some tiles
data.body:
That two tiles are Cliff-Type-Changer and sorted at false place. Also they are cliff but their tiles were Rough.
![adsiz](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7933210/5603444/1cf73b80-938e-11e4-8b58-8849337dcca9.png)

data.title: Unable to move unit on Desert Twister
data.body:
When starting a game in Dune2000 with the map Desert Twister,
Player/Ai that started at spawn A or C, they will be unable to move their MCV.

if the game is started with support, some if not all of the unit will be unable to move.

data.title: Added the Dune 2000 Guarding voice
data.body: as requested in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7147.

data.title: Fix incorrect name for lobby headers container in TD
data.body: ...which caused the headers to still be visible when the options bin was open.

data.title: Travis compiling script should not continue when exitcode returns non-zero
data.body:
In a few build on travis i noticed that the script will continue, when a part of the script failing...

for example... CSC failes while it compiles the editor ... after that the script continues ... with openra-utility.exe `--check_yaml` at the end, travis will say... error, that fact!

we should abort the script on the first error that is happening .. instead of continue the script.

in this log the compiler fils but the script continues... :(

https://travis-ci.org/OpenRA/OpenRA/builds/45725147

data.title: Moving more files to Common
data.body:
- Moved `GivesBounty`, `GivesExperience` and `GainsExperience` traits, along with the `Rank` effect
- Moved the `DetectCloaked` trait
- Moved the `PlayerStatistics` trait
- Moved the `Enter` and `RepairBuilding` activities
- Moved the `EngineerRepair` trait
- Moved `ActorExts`
- Extracted the `IgnoresDisguise` trait to its own file

data.title: Tweaked the StyleCop utility output
data.body: to enhance readability as you only care for what went wrong not has been checked okay.

data.title: Create a true headless OpenRA.Server.exe
data.body:
instead of always checking against `Game.Settings.Server.Dedicated` and deciding individually whether it should be loaded.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/7440668-create-a-true-headless-openra-server-exe?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: StyleCop cleaned OpenRA.Game Part 1
data.body: Followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7247. It grew big sadly so I split it in two commits.

data.title: Refactored NotifyBlocker() (and several overloads) into ActorExts
data.body: Moved the notification of blocking actors (INotifyBlockingMove) into Actor class, it was used in three different places more or less the same way.

data.title: Added a check for Byte Order Marks
data.body: So the Travis build will alert us when they are re-introduced again.
